item.title: Trump Announces Plan To Privatize Air Traffic Control
item.description: June 5, 2017 - It's an idea long supported by most of the commercial airlines and the union who say the system is inefficient under the Federal Aviation Administration.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - It's an idea long supported by most of the commercial airlines and the union who say the system is inefficient under the Federal Aviation Administration. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/05/531574945/trump-announces-plan-to-privatize-air-traffic-control

item.title: Videotapes Are Becoming Unwatchable As Archivists Work To Save Them
item.description: June 3, 2017 - With VHS tapes degrading, most Americans' home videos from the '80s and '90s won't be viewable in a decade. But there's a grassroots movement to preserve them for posterity.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 3, 2017 - With VHS tapes degrading, most Americans' home videos from the '80s and '90s won't be viewable in a decade. But there's a grassroots movement to preserve them for posterity. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/03/529155865/videotapes-are-becoming-unwatchable-as-archivists-work-to-save-them

item.title: Massachusetts Tries Something New To Claim Taxes From Online Sales
item.description: June 2, 2017 - States have long argued that they are losing millions of dollars in uncollected taxes from online sales. Massachusetts is now trying a very Internet answer to this Internet problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - States have long argued that they are losing millions of dollars in uncollected taxes from online sales. Massachusetts is now trying a very Internet answer to this Internet problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/02/531222247/massachusetts-tries-something-new-to-claim-taxes-from-online-sales

item.title: A 1A Special: Putting Paris In Perspective
item.description: June 1, 2017 - President Trump has made his decision – and plans to withdraw the United States from the 2015 Paris climate agreement. It’s a move that places Washington at odds with virtually the entire international community.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - President Trump has made his decision – and plans to withdraw the United States from the 2015 Paris climate agreement. It’s a move that places Washington at odds with virtually the entire international community. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-01/a-1a-special-putting-paris-in-perspective

item.title: In $43 Million Settlement, Spotify Forced To Confront A Persistent Problem
item.description: June 1, 2017 - The streaming service settled a class action lawsuit filed by songwriters who accused Spotify of using their work without a license.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - The streaming service settled a class action lawsuit filed by songwriters who accused Spotify of using their work without a license. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/06/01/531029555/in-43-million-settlement-spotify-forced-to-confront-a-persistent-problem

item.title: Banned From Russian TV, A Putin Critic Gets His Message Out On YouTube
item.description: June 1, 2017 - Anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny is calling for nationwide protests and wants to be president. The Kremlin is scrambling to respond to the freewheeling weekly show he's started on YouTube.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - Anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny is calling for nationwide protests and wants to be president. The Kremlin is scrambling to respond to the freewheeling weekly show he's started on YouTube. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/06/01/530322343/banned-from-russian-tv-a-putin-critic-gets-his-message-out-on-youtube

item.title: Amazon Offers Refunds For Children's Unauthorized In-App Purchases
item.description: May 31, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued the retail giant over charges incurred by kids using apps. Both sides dropped their appeals so the refunds could begin.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued the retail giant over charges incurred by kids using apps. Both sides dropped their appeals so the refunds could begin. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/31/530903237/amazon-offers-refunds-for-childrens-unauthorized-in-app-purchases

item.title: In Remote Southern California Desert, U.S. Army Tests Advanced Cyber Weapons
item.description: May 31, 2017 - Soldiers at the remote Fort Irwin, Calif., center are training with a new generation of cyber weapons. Turns out, electronic gizmos can make a difference on a real life battlefield.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - Soldiers at the remote Fort Irwin, Calif., center are training with a new generation of cyber weapons. Turns out, electronic gizmos can make a difference on a real life battlefield. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/31/530929908/in-remote-southern-california-desert-u-s-army-tests-advanced-cyber-weapons

item.title: Total Failure: The World's Worst Video Game
item.description: May 31, 2017 - In the late summer of 1982, one man worked around the clock to program the video game version of Steven Spielberg's E.T. in just five weeks. The result wasn't pretty.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - In the late summer of 1982, one man worked around the clock to program the video game version of Steven Spielberg's E.T. in just five weeks. The result wasn't pretty. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/31/530235165/total-failure-the-worlds-worst-video-game

item.title: Call Me: Why Backchannels Matter
item.description:
May 31, 2017 - What are backchannels with foreign nations for? And can they be abused?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-31/call-me-why-backchannels-matter
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - What are backchannels with foreign nations for? And can they be abused? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-31/call-me-why-backchannels-matter

item.title: The Internet's First Amendment: The New Fight For Net Neutrality
item.description: May 31, 2017 - The head of the Federal Communications Commission plans to change the rules on Net Neutrality. But consumer advocates say the move would largely leave the industry to police itself. How do we keep the internet open, free AND competitive?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - The head of the Federal Communications Commission plans to change the rules on Net Neutrality. But consumer advocates say the move would largely leave the industry to police itself. How do we keep the internet open, free AND competitive? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-31/the-battle-over-net-neutrality

item.title: Activists Build Human Rights Abuse Cases With Help From Cellphone Videos
item.description: May 31, 2017 - A human rights group finds itself with an interesting problem — an overwhelming number of videos to catalog as it builds legal cases. Computer scientists are creating tools to analyze the videos.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - A human rights group finds itself with an interesting problem — an overwhelming number of videos to catalog as it builds legal cases. Computer scientists are creating tools to analyze the videos. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/05/31/529825301/activists-build-human-rights-abuse-cases-with-help-from-cellphone-videos

item.title: Flipbooks Help Prisoners Stay Connected To Their Loved Ones
item.description: May 29, 2017 - For people in prison, rules limiting access to technology make seeing video of their kids' first steps difficult. But a Colorado woman is using a 19th century solution for this 21st century problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - For people in prison, rules limiting access to technology make seeing video of their kids' first steps difficult. But a Colorado woman is using a 19th century solution for this 21st century problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/29/525874568/flipbooks-help-prisoners-stay-connected-to-their-loved-ones

item.title: British Airways IT Meltdown Leaves Passengers Stranded
item.description: May 29, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with Robert Wall of The Wall Street Journal about the British Airways software issue which required cancelling flights.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with Robert Wall of The Wall Street Journal about the British Airways software issue which required cancelling flights. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/29/530617251/british-airways-it-meltdown-leaves-passengers-stranded

item.title: For Video Soundtracks, Computers Are The New Composers
item.description: May 29, 2017 - In some cases, the job of composer might be going the way of typewriter repairman and bowling pinsetter as software creates music more cheaply and quickly than humans. Can you hear the difference?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - In some cases, the job of composer might be going the way of typewriter repairman and bowling pinsetter as software creates music more cheaply and quickly than humans. Can you hear the difference? http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/29/530259126/for-video-soundtracks-computers-are-the-new-composers
